displaytitle: America is the best country in the world. In Azores we'd go to the movies and America would seem like a dream. We came here with fifty dollars in our pocket and worked twelve hours a day, six days a week to save money to buy this dry-cleaning business. America is better than we thought. We have everything we ever wanted. Tri-Valley Area, Northern California
creditline: Gift of M. Robin Krasny, Class of 1973
inscribed:
Verso: In graphite, upper left: V0629 | 4000
Verso: In ink, center: W-716 | 717
signed: Signed in graphite on verso, lower left: Bill Owens

displaymaker: Bill Owens, born 1938, San Jose, CA; active Hayward
caption: Bill Owens (born 1938, San Jose, CA; active Hayward), America is the best country in the world. In Azores we'd go to the movies and America would seem like a dream. We came here with fifty dollars in our pocket and worked twelve hours a day, six days a week to save money to buy this dry-cleaning business. America is better than we thought. We have everything we ever wanted. Tri-Valley Area, Northern California, 1974. Gelatin silver print; 17 × 21.5 cm (image), 20 × 25.3 cm (sheet). Gift of M. Robin Krasny, Class of 1973 (2018-208)
